word: There is to be no slavery. The service of all is to be cheerful and willing. But those who train the youth in our institutions have one disadvantage to work against. There are many who in the homelife have received an imperfect training. Often the mother makes herself the slave of her children, and in so doing neglects her most important work--the training of her children to wait on themselves, to follow habits of neatness, order, and thoroughness in the little things of life. . . .
